Description.val:
Beginning in FY18 this funding line represents a consolidation of ammunition line items by functional capability.

This line includes demolition items, hand held grenades, pyrotechnic devices, land mines, and non-lethal weapons.  

Demolition items provide high explosives for the purpose of destroying or altering man-made or natural objects or obstacles.  Demolition munitions charges include block charges, shaped charges, flexible-linear charges, explosive sheet, cable, canine explosive scent items, chain cutters and military dynamite. They are used for general demolition, cutting, breaching, cratering, and destruction of abandoned equipment/ ammunition.  

Also included are all hand held/vehicle launched grenades, pyrotechnics, and land mines used by ground forces of the Marine Corps.  This includes colored smoke grenades, various pyrotechnics used in training to simulate battlefield affects, and the claymore mine.  

Additionally, this family also has non-lethal munition variants such as; 12 gauge, 40mm grenades, diversionary grenades, 81mm non-lethal mortars and the Mission Payload Module (MPMN) system.  These munitions are intended to incapacitate, warn or drive off targeted personnel or materiel; while minimizing permanent injury to personnel, and damage to property in the target area or environment.

The funds prior to FY18 are contained in line items 1030, 1468, 1500 and 1628.

Justification.val:
This line includes the funding in support of all linear charges, Hand Held/Vehicle launched grenades, pyrotechnic devices, land mines, demolition items, and non-lethal munition programs.

FY 2019 baseline funding will procure Hand Grenades (DODIC G881), 66mm Vehicle Launched Grenades (DODIC GG24), line charges (DODIC M913), Arrester Cable Release Mechanism (ACRM) (DODIC MLAC), and Anti-Personal Obstacle Breaching Systems (APOBS) (DODIC MN79) items to support required training, this includes annual training requirements as well as any pre-deployment training. 

FY 2019 funds will also be used for Engineering Support In Production (ESIP). ESIP costs support engineering functions on produced units which includes quality assurance, configuration management, lot acceptance testing, and support for items currently in production.  Additionally, this funding addresses any changes to the design during production, assuring that the ammunition is of the highest quality, and deals with any manufacturing concerns during these processes.

The baseline increase from FY18 to FY19 of $19.789M is due to increases for the Arrester Cable Release Mechanism (DODIC MLAC), a new item to provide safety for the ABV operators; M913 to provide additional training requirements, MN79 to provide additional rounds due to defects in the current inventory; and increased training requirements for G881 and GG24.

OCO: 
FY 2019 Overseas Contingency Operations (OCO) funding will be used to reset munitions expended in support of Operation Inherent Resolve (OIR).  Funding will procure additional Anti-Personal Obstacle Breaching Systems (APOBS) (DODIC MN79) to support required training, this includes annual training requirements as well as any pre-deployment training.
